main event: An unidentified flying object (UFO) was sighted and reportedly crashed in Galveston, Texas in March 1948. The witness observed a loud roaring noise and saw the object sailing over the telephone poles, estimating it to be around twelve or thirteen feet in span.
interesting points: The witness kept the information to himself and did not reveal it to his friends.
The sighting occurred around midnight on the road to Galveston, Texas.
The object was described as having a circular and narrow shape, with flashing lights on the water after it allegedly crashed.
The document includes hand-drawn sketches depicting different views of the UFO, labeled as 'Top view' and a side profile.

There was a request for an investigation of the sighting and apparent crash of the UFO, as reported by an enclosed letter, issued by Colonel W. R. Clingherman, Chief of Analysis Division, Intelligence Department, USAF.
